intro: Pavonia transvaalensis, commonly known as the Transvaal hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with palmate leaves and produces small, yellow flowers clustered in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and visually appealing addition to gardens in suitable climates.
